snippet: Mayor Michael Bloomberg argued that critics of his stop-and-frisk policy needed to brush up on math and logic. The same could be said of His Honor.
abstract: Editorial takes issue with Mayor Michael Bloomberg's brusk contention that stop-and-frisk policy is in line with statistical realities of crime in New York City; holds Bloomberg should take his own advice when it comes to brushing up on mathematics; cites data indicating that at least 170,000 such stops have been unlawful, and that policy has not in fact been effective in reducing city's murder rate.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael Bloomberg argued that critics of his stop-and-frisk policy needed to brush up on math and logic. The same could be said of His Honor.
